name: Cyber Threat Response
description: Mission Defense Team battle drills for live incidents.

cards.title: MDT Battle Drill 0
cards.description: Practice the initial triage call: confirm indicators, halt spread, and notify C3 with mission impact statements per USSF MDT CONOPS. Ref: SDP 3-0.
cards.summaryText: The first five minutes set tempo—train until the script is reflex.

cards.title: Kill Chain Mapping
cards.description: Rapidly map observed indicators onto the Lockheed Martin kill chain to focus countermeasures. Ref: AFI 17-102.
cards.summaryText: Translate messy logs into a clear adversary kill chain within minutes.

cards.title: Forensic Imaging SOP
cards.description: Rehearse cold imaging of mission servers with write blockers, hashing, and chain-of-custody docs per AFMAN 71-102. Ref: AFI 71-101 V1.
cards.summaryText: Evidence only holds up if Guardians preserve it perfectly.

cards.title: Containment Decision Tree
cards.description: Walk through isolation options (interface shutdown, ACL, hypervisor snapshot) while weighing mission downtime. Ref: USCYBERCOM JFHQ-DODIN TTPs.
cards.summaryText: Contain smart—protect the mission even while fighting malware.

cards.title: Hunt Hypothesis Lab
cards.description: Formulate and test hypotheses using threat intel, MITRE ATT&CK, and local telemetry to find footholds. Ref: AFMAN 17-1203.
cards.summaryText: Winning hunts start with disciplined hypotheses and end with evidence.

cards.title: Incident Communications
cards.description: Draft SITREP inputs that address what happened, risk to mission, and required support in Guardian Downlink formats. Ref: AFMAN 10-417.
cards.summaryText: Incident comms build trust—make them crisp and doctrinal.

cards.title: Eradication & Recovery Runbook
cards.description: Sequence eradication steps, validation tests, and phased restoration for mission systems. Ref: NIST SP 800-61r2.
cards.summaryText: When recovery is scripted, commanders say yes faster.

cards.title: Threat Intel Fusion
cards.description: Fuse DIA, NSA, and commercial intel extracts with local indicators to update adversary TTP profiles. Ref: AFDP 2-0.
cards.summaryText: Great responders know their adversary's next move before it lands.

cards.title: ICS Incident Timeline
cards.description: Build a precise OT incident timeline by combining historian logs, PLC captures, and facility data. Ref: NIST SP 800-82.
cards.summaryText: Space ground segments include OT—treat it as part of the battle space.

cards.title: After-Action & Lessons
cards.description: Conduct hotwash using AFMAN 90-1601 templates to lock in lessons, assign owners, and update TTPs. Ref: AFDP 3-0.
cards.summaryText: Every incident should make the next response faster.

cards.title: Evidence Retention Policy
cards.description: Review classification guides, retention timelines, and legal holds so data is preserved correctly. Ref: AFMAN 51-203.
cards.summaryText: Evidence mishandled equals cases lost—guard it.

cards.title: JADC2 Reporting Inject
cards.description: Practice packaging cyber incident effects for JADC2 nodes so air, land, and maritime partners understand the impact. Ref: ABMS Playbook.
cards.summaryText: Cyber ops must plug cleanly into the joint kill chain—train it now.
